text.__SUMMARY__: Eryx elegans (Central Asian sand boa, elegant sand boa) is a nonvenomous boa species endemic to western Central Asia. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Description: Not well known in the wild or in captivity, this is a small species, reaching about 15 inches (38 cm) in total length (including tail). The dorsal scales are small and slightly keeled.  Coloration is very drab, consisting of a light olive-brown background, with small, irregular, darker brown blotches with black edges running along the back.  There are also brown blotches on the ventral surface.
text.Geographic range: E. elegans is found in southern Turkmenistan, northern Iran (the Kopet Dag mountains in the north-east and the Azerbaijan region in the north-west), and Afghanistan. The type locality given is "Afghanistan."
